newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan vegoil rates seen down on low demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan vegoil rates seen down on low demand.

text.p: Pakistani vegetable oil rates are likely to slip next week on low domestic demand and depressed international prices, dealers said on Saturday.
"During summer, vegoil demand usually drops," dealer Amir Chattha of Saulat Enterprises said. "Vegoil rates are also under pressure in the international market."
Dealer Mohammad Kamran said sellers were unloading stocks to square their positions before the end of fiscal 1996/97 (July-June). "But in July, domestic prices could rise slightly."
Three ships with around 24,800 tonnes of vegoil are due in the next couple of days, while 182,000 tonnes of unsold stocks are available in the market, dealers said.
Local vegoil production is expected to rise in 1997/98. "Sunflower oil supplies have already started, while cotton seed and canola oil will start coming by August," Chattha said.
Vegoil stocks rose to around 182,000 tonnes from 157,000 tonnes on June 21.
